page.title: 04THWAITES VILLAGE POLICEMAN
page.content: Opposite our school there is a police station. We went to interview the policeman and asked him some questions about his job. On a typical day he visits his section office (Millom Police Station) to write reports, answer telephone enquiries and tell his supervisor what he has been doing and to get instructions. He then goes on foot patrol. He has to deal with community policing, road traffic offences, and traffic accidents. He also has to check on property and tell people about gun regulations. He travels about sixty miles in a day. Every year he trains some children from Thwaites School for their Cycling Proficiency test. The policeman gets to know all the children at school and they all know him.
